text:
I think I figured out what was missing from the discussion of the addition of lambdas to Excel the other month: the implications for BallmerCon 2021. Honestly it seems like a huge META-breaker. Does Microsoft even care about the pro scene anymore? It’s like XLOOKUP all over again!
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xubbVvKbUfY>

attachments.title: MAKRO | Microsoft Excel Stream Highlights 3/19
attachments.fallback: YouTube Video: MAKRO | Microsoft Excel Stream Highlights 3/19

elements.text: I think I figured out what was missing from the discussion of the addition of lambdas to Excel the other month: the implications for BallmerCon 2021. Honestly it seems like a huge META-breaker. Does Microsoft even care about the pro scene anymore? It’s like XLOOKUP all over again!

text:
Apparently someone embedded Jupyter Notebooks into Excel:
<https://towardsdatascience.com/python-jupyter-notebooks-in-excel-5ab34fc6439>

I wonder if we can get a Julia kernel running there.

attachments.title: Python Jupyter Notebooks in Excel
attachments.text: Embed Jupyter into Microsoft Excel and write Python instead of VBA

I wonder if we can get a Julia kernel running there.

text: Finally, a way to make nice-looking plots in Excel! But at what cost… :laughing:
